Description: Upper body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; part of elaborate rosette in added white outline with added red centres; exterior narrow brown lines at rim (now lost); below, tail of probable lion to left; at right, part of elaborate rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the decoration, see British Museum 1965,0930.330.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0899) (phase 2)
